required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Randomized Trial of Alternative HPV Vaccination Schedules in Males in a University Setting
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Trial of Alternative HPV Vaccination Schedules in Males in a University Setting

brief_summary.textblock:
The investigators propose a randomized, open label trial of the immunogenicity of HPV vaccine among males 18-24 years old, comparing an on-time administration of the third dose with delayed administration of the third dose. All participants would receive the first and second doses according to schedule. They would be randomized to either Dose 3 at 6 months or Dose 3 at 12 months.
Hypothesis: The Geometric mean titers in the 12 month test group (T) are non-inferior to the usual timing control group (C):
H0: δ ≤ −δ0 versus H1: δ > −δ0 where δ = log (GMTT )− log (GMTC) and δ0 is the pre-specified non-inferiority margin

detailed_description.textblock:
1. Specific Aims and Overview: The investigators propose a randomized, open label trial of HPV vaccine among males 18-24 years old, comparing an on-time administration of the third dose with delayed administration of the third dose. All participants would receive the first and second doses according to schedule. They would be randomized to either Dose 3 at 6 months or Dose 3 at 12 months.
Blood would be drawn for titers at twice from all participants: pre-dose 1 and one month post Dose 3.
No cytology studies or DNA studies will be conducted.
1.1 Aims:
1. Determine if delay in the third dose is immunologically non-inferior to the standard administration schedule (1 month post-dose 3).
2. Determine the side effect profile of a delayed third dose, in comparison to the standard schedule.
3. Determine the preference and compliance of the men for the timing of the third dose.
1.2 Hypothesis for non- inferiority:
The GMTs in the test group (T) are non-inferior to the usual timing control group (C):
H0: δ ≤ −δ0 versus H1: δ > −δ0 where δ = log (GMTT )− log (GMTC) and δ0 is the pre-specified non-inferiority margin.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month after dose 3 (e.g., month 7 if third dose at 6months or month 13 if third dose at 12 months)
primary_outcome.description: Geometric mean titer (GMT) and 95% confidence intervals around titer 1 month after dose 3 in per protocol population, comparing the two groups.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 3rd dose (i.e., at month 6 or month 12, depending on arm)
secondary_outcome.description: Determine the compliance of the men for the timing of the third dose.
Total proportion of side effects reported after any dose, compared by arm.

arm_group.description: Administration of 3rd dose at 12 months quadrivalent human papillomavirus vaccine
Administration of 3rd dose at 6 months quadrivalent human papillomavirus vaccine

intervention.description: 0.5 mL of quadrivalent HPV vaccine at enrollment, 2 months, and 12 months
0.5 mL of quadrivalent HPV vaccine at enrollment, 2 months, and 6 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males age 18-26
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hospitalization within the past year
- Previous HPV vaccination
>/=5 sexual partners (i.e., insertive intercourse) No other drug studies within 30 days of proposed HPV vaccination
- History of genital warts
- Immunosuppression
- Other vaccines within 8 days of proposed HPV vaccination
- Hypersensitivity to yeast or HPV vaccine components
- Known autoimmune disorders
- Receipt of immunoglobulins or blood product within 90 days of enrollment (may defer until 90 days completed)
- Serious Adverse Reaction to HPV vaccine

reference.citation: Zimmerman RK, Nowalk MP, Lin CJ, Fox DE, Ko FS, Wettick E, Cost G, Hand L, Hayes J, Michaels M. Randomized trial of an alternate human papillomavirus vaccine administration schedule in college-aged women. J Womens Health (Larchmt). 2010 Aug;19(8):1441-7. doi: 10.1089/jwh.2009.1753.

results_reference.citation: Lin CJ, Zimmerman RK, Nowalk MP, Huang HH, Raviotta JM. Randomized controlled trial of two dosing schedules for human papillomavirus vaccination among college age males. Vaccine. 2014 Feb 3;32(6):693-9. doi: 10.1016/j.vaccine.2013.11.098. Epub 2013 Dec 14.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: From October 2010 through May 2011, college age men, ages 18-25 years, were recruited using a variety of strategies including fliers, class announcements, recommendations by university health centers, emails to campus organizations, bus and campus newspaper advertisements, and targeted Facebook® advertisements.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Exclusion criteria were: >4 lifetime sexual partners, health problems that would interfere with the immune response or ability to complete the study, a hospitalization during the past year, hypersensitivity to yeast or HPV vaccine components, inability to complete appointments, received HPV vaccine or immunosuppressive medications.

outcome.description: Geometric mean titer (GMT) and 95% confidence intervals around titer 1 month after dose 3 in per protocol population, comparing the two groups.
outcome.time_frame: 1 month after dose 3 (e.g., month 7 if third dose at 6months or month 13 if third dose at 12 months)

measure.title: Immunogenicity After Dose 3
measure.description: Geometric mean titer (GMT) and 95% confidence intervals around titer 1 month after dose 3 in per protocol population, comparing the two groups.

analysis.groups_desc: The primary endpoint would demonstrate noninferiority if the upper bound of the 95% two-sided confidence interval (CI) of the ratio of GMT for Standard schedule group divided by that of Alternate schedule group is <1.5.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Sample size: (1 + 1/u)(Zα + Zβ)2 σ2 /[log (RGMT) −δ0] u= ratio of the size of the Standard schedule to Alternate schedule groups (u =1, for equal size groups); one-sided alpha (0.025)/4 for multiplicity of serotypes. Average log-transformed and geometric mean titers (GMTs) with a two-sided 95% confidence interval of the ratio of the GMTs were used. Non-inferiority is determined if upper bound GMT ratio of standard group to alternate group < 1.5.
analysis.estimate_desc: Non-inferiority is determined if upper bound GMT ratio of standard 6 month group to alternate 12 month group < 1.5.

outcome.description: Determine the compliance of the men for the timing of the third dose.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Drop-out rates higher in the Alternate group; however, sample size was met for all HPV types. The effect of the Alternate dosing schedule on long-term clinical outcomes is unknown. One syncopal episode related to phlebotomy prior to vaccination.

point_of_contact.organization: University of Pittsburgh Department of Family Medicine
